comments:
With jdk7 as my default java version, when I run eclipse 3.2, the splash screen appears for a few seconds, then goes away, and a litte window informs me that an error has occured, and where the log file is (which is actually very helpful - thanks to those responsible for this elegant error handling).

jdk7 b01 is supposed to only really differ from recent jdk6 build in version strings, so I'm guessing a new version identification might affect something.

Workaround: Add to eclipse.ini

-vm
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javaw.exe

Here is the log file:

The issue is we do not have a jdk7 profile to set the execution environment of OSGi.  This causes the framework to fail to resolve and the IllegalStateException to occur.  The IllegalStateException error message is very bad or non-existant.  This has been fixed in bug 151413 along with the NPE in EclipseStarter that happens when the execution environment is not set.


JavaSE 7 is a ways out so I do not really want to add a profile to support it just yet.  Instead I have added code to allow the framework to fallback to an earlier profile.  In this case it will fall back to JavaSE 6 profile.

If you want to use your own java profile for JavaSE 7 then you can set the osgi.java.profile system property to specify a URL to your own custom profile.

Thanks (for the fixes & the info), I now have eclipse 3.2 running on jdk7. 

Simplest workaround (for anyone else reading this bug report) is to create or edit eclipse.ini, and add the following two lines (you might already have the -vmargs line):

-vmarg
-Dosgi.java.profile=jar:file:///eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_3.2.0.v20060601.jar!/JavaSE-1.6.profile



But here is what I actually did:

1) Searched for examples profiles, found them in org.eclipse.osgi_3.2.0.v20060601.jar

2) Copied JavaSE-1.6.profile out of there, to my c:\eclipse directory

3) renamed it to JavaSE-1.7.profile

4) edited it so that the last lines now read

 J2SE-1.5,\
 JavaSE-1.6,\
 JavaSE-1.7
osgi.java.profile.name = JavaSE-1.7

5) altered c:\eclipse\eclipse.ini so that it contained (amongst other things)

-vmargs
-Dosgi.java.profile=file:///eclipse/JavaSE-1.7.profile
*** Bug 176927 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
